items.sentence: I have so many things to tell you that I don\'t know where to start.
Tom and Mary don\'t seem to really talk to each other all that much.
Tom would rather let Mary have her own way than to have an argument.
What was the name of the hotel where you stayed in Boston last year?
Tom can\'t forget the time he and Mary had their first big argument.
If at all possible, you should go and look into the matter yourself.
I should\'ve known Tom would do something we didn\'t want him to do.
That teacher sometimes hits his students, but no one ever complains.
The last time we all went out drinking, I was the designated driver.
I think Tom needs to start hanging out with someone other than Mary.
Tom looked over his shoulder to see if Mary was still following him.
Tom made a frantic attempt to finish painting the fence before dark.
Tom made it quite clear why we had to have the job finished by 2:30.
Tom never suspected that Mary was the one who had stolen his wallet.
Please return the book I lent you after you\'ve finished reading it.
She\'d just begun to read the book when someone knocked on the door.
She\'s signed up for a couple of night classes at the local college.
Tom decided that he wouldn\'t tell Mary anything about the incident.
Tom didn\'t really feel like going out drinking with the other guys.
Tom didn\'t think he had enough money in his wallet to pay the bill.
